metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11061 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Bareos Director less than or equal to 16.2.10, 17.2.9, 18.2.8, and 19.2.7, a heap overflow allows a malicious client to corrupt the director's memory via oversized digest strings sent during initialization of a verify job. Disabling verify jobs mitigates the problem. This issue is also patched in Bareos versions 19.2.8, 18.2.9 and 17.2.10.

criterions.comment: bacula package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
